results.title: Expulsion
results.brief_description: A meticulous reconstruction of five crucial days in the life of a college for children in their last school year in Berkshire. A drug ring was discovered at the school. This led to mass expulsions, and to a tragic and unforeseen sequel. The film brings the problems of children and drugs to the fore and emphasises the need to take a stand on the issue.

results.title: Expressionism
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau, Egons Tomsons and George Barford
results.brief_description: Traces the development of the basically German Expressionist Movement which exaggerated both color and form to express emotional and psychological attitudes. Includes the work of Munch, Kirchner, Heckel, Schmidt-Rottluff, Nolde, Pechstein, Kokoschka, Bdckmann, Kandinsky, Marc and Klee. Suitable for secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: International Film Bureau, Egons Tomsons and George Barford

results.title: Expressionism
results.brief_description: The first half of this program describes expressionism as the alteration by an artist of the appearances of his subject to the extreme that the objects are painted in obviously abnormal forms. The second half compares and contrasts Kandinski’s emotional abstractions with Mondrian’s intellectual approach.
results.description: The first half of this program describes expressionism as the alteration by an artist of the appearances of his subject to the extreme that the objects are painted in obviously abnormal forms. The second half compares and contrasts Kandinski’s emotional abstractions with Mondrian’s intellectual approach.

results.title: Expressing a twentieth century vision
results.creator_credit: David Hopwood and Northern Virginia Community College. Extended Learning Institute
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Developing image”.
This program probes how the photograph has been used as a metaphor to describe the photographer’s inner state. This is in contrast to traditional approaches to realistic photography. Individual photographers discuss the use of metaphor in their own experiences and works.

results.title: Express yourself
results.brief_description: Join young Tommy and his friend “Feelings” for a challenging day of dealing with emotions - the day of the Little League championships, which is also the day before Tommy’s eighth birthday. Feelings helps Tommy recognise what he may be feeling, as well as some of the physical signs of emotions, and Tommy learns that while recognising and expressing your feelings may be difficult, the rewards are many, including an increased sense of control and self esteem. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.

results.title: Exposure
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Film Board and Thorold Dickinson
results.brief_description: A compilation of footage showing the plight of the world’s homeless estimated at 40 million after World War II. Includes pictures of refugee life in the hope of raising international public awareness and support to help the refugees.

results.title: Exports flow through Fremantle
results.creator_credit: Fremantle Port Authority, Les Bambury and Supreme Sound Studios
